intro: Chaerophyllum trichospermum, commonly known as the hairy cow parsley, is a flowering plant in the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small white or greenish flowers arranged in umbels. Native to Europe and parts of Asia, it thrives in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant has a taproot system and produces small, hairy fruits that are dispersed by wind. Its botanical features make it a common weed in disturbed soils and a valuable plant for ecological studies.
